intro: Eriosema gossweileri, commonly known as the silverleaf eriosema, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy flowers. The plant features a hairy stem and foliage, giving it a distinctive silver-green appearance. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny conditions. Eriosema gossweileri is often found in grassland and shrubland habitats, contributing to the biodiversity of its native regions.
